instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2015 Macbook Air 11in. All the lights are on, but nobody is home
threads.message:
Going through a pile of ''do that another day'' machines and came across a few now with similar problems.

This one is an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Every rail present, fan spinning, magsafe light on, no image or backlight.  No cpu activity - (no USB activity). CPU or PCH gets hot normal hot, not hot hot.

Another couple of <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>'s and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>'s with similar issues.

Anyone got any idea's?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2015 Macbook Air 11in. All the lights are on, but nobody is home
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high?
Did you try BIOS?
Any history fault available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2015 Macbook Air 11in. All the lights are on, but nobody is home
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.335v
Try Bios? Yes, downloaded and flashed with two different ones and kept original too obviously.
Only fault history I have is the description from the seller which said that the macbook ''came in with'' a blown battery and looked like liquid damage. The 'came in with' part suggests to me they are a repairer who MAY have cleaned of liquid damage and/or tried to repair before I got.

The only thing I found was <RESISTOR>R5127</RESISTOR> which looked like one end was black/dark grey and although it tested at 0ohm, I replaced anyway. Pads were fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2015 Macbook Air 11in. All the lights are on, but nobody is home
threads.message:
Working after previous repair attempts is mostly nightmare.
You may have some knocked off components, or broken trace.
Can't be sure if they didn't already stressed CPU with heat.

Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Also the ones from LPC bus.
Reball, or change SMC.

Not too much hope in such kind of projects...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2015 Macbook Air 11in. All the lights are on, but nobody is home
threads.message:
I agree 100%. I usually avoid anything that even hints of being repaired, especially if they mention 'local computer shop' who almost always do not know anything about Macs and seem to undo things with a hammer, chissel and blowtorch before putting it kind of back in the case and claiming not repairable.

I am usually careful when buying on ebay etc also, especially the magic term ''untested'' which always means extensively tested and repairs attempted before giving up and selling.

But this one I simply did not read the ad. I didn't pay much, but as a 2015 model it would be nice to get it back to life. If it still had the liquid damage, I might have a chance, but once cleaned off we all know how bad these can be.

Had a really carefull examination of the board before. No missing or knocked off parts at least. Also SMC still has edge bonding, so there is some small hope.

I will do some more checking, but it is frustrating when they spin the fan, get green/orange light,  all rails present yet no cpu cativity and by that I mean no USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2015 Macbook Air 11in. All the lights are on, but nobody is home
threads.message:
All SPI ternmination correct.

J tag splotless

Rails:
[LIST]
[*]8.59v
[*]5.14v
[*]3.339v
[*]1.206v
[*]1.063v
[*]1.810v
[*]1.811v
[*]3.438v
[/LIST]

[LIST]
[*]Green light then amber light
[*]Fan spin
[*]Starts, shuts down, starts and runs at 604ma once up and running.
[/LIST]

No USB/CPU activity (Chipmunk)

I could see some minor signs of previous liquid damage near pins 2 & 3 of <CHIP>U6101</CHIP>, so removed <CHIP>U6101</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, cleaned and put back original <CHIP>U6101</CHIP> (don't have another) and <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> (have some).

Removed LIO Flex, and runs same (but no light obviously).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2015 Macbook Air 11in. All the lights are on, but nobody is home
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2015 Macbook Air 11in. All the lights are on, but nobody is home
threads.message: That is next. because the edge bonding is still there, it would have been nice to solve this without reballing, but I have no problem doing that now as I have checked everything else.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2015 Macbook Air 11in. All the lights are on, but nobody is home
threads.message:
Yes, you were correct. It was the SMC. Took it off and there was crud under chip. Cleaned up, reballed and it now runs perfectly.

Thank you very much for your help. It just shows, the reason I didn't hone in on the SMC was because the edge bonding was intact. I was looking for what the last owner did and missed the actual fault that he also missed.

Very grateful for your extensive knowledge and understanding of these machines.[ATTACH type="full"]59946[/ATTACH][ATTACH]59946[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2015 Macbook Air 11in. All the lights are on, but nobody is home
threads.message:
ALWAYS reball SMC, when detect liquid sign near it.
<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> is close enough to suspect that...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2015 Macbook Air 11in. All the lights are on, but nobody is home
threads.message: Very fair point and good advice. VERY much appreciated.
